context.p: A Requirement Area (RA) represents a whole unit or a subsection of a Product Development Group (PDG). Each Deployment artifact must have an associated RA.
Update an RA within the PDU OSS Deployment Tracking Tool.

NOTE: No User is permitted to create an RA within DTT. Users with permissions are permitted to fill in only the available fields. The RA data is sourced from Team Inventory Tool. If anything is incorrect from the following: Name or Program, you must go to the Team Inventory Tool to fix it. Then DTT will be updated during next Team Inventory Tool check which happens once a day automatically.

prereq.p: To create a new Requirement Area the user must have the following:

info.p: Click the 'RAs' link in the navigation bar.
Click the Edit button beside any RA in the list.
Enter the details as shown below.
NOTE: Any restrictions on the fields are outlined.

ul.li: Name: Name of the Requirement Area. Value is sourced from Team Inventory Tool and cannot be changed.
Program: Must be an existing Program. Value is sourced from Team Inventory Tool and cannot be changed.

Booking Assignee User: This field relates to the creation of JIRA Issue for Bookings. Select the User to be set as assignee to all JIRA Issues created for Bookings associated with this Requirement Area.
Maximum Booking Duration (Days): Optional - The maximum number of days a Deployment can be booked for. Leave field empty for no limit.
Maximum Booking Advance (Weeks): Optional - The furthest point in time a Deployment booking can finish, specified in weeks. Leave field empty for no limit.
User: Select a User from a list. NOTE User must be signed in at least once to DTT for it to be visible in the list.
Permission Type: Type of permission the User will have.

info.p: Click the Save button, the RA will be updated, and the user will be redirected back to the view page for the modified RA.
NOTE: RA will not save if any fields are invalid (invalid fields are highlighted in red).

result.p: An RA is updated in the PDU OSS Deployment Tracking Tool.
